perturbation.original_text: Supplier will, upon request from Purchaser or Playboy, deliver to Purchaser or will destroy in the presence of Purchaser or its representative(s), all molds, designs or any other elements used in reproducing any or all of the Playboy Properties.
perturbation.changed_text: Supplier will, upon request from Purchaser or Playboy, manage all molds, designs or any other elements used in reproducing any or all of the Playboy Properties.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit requirements to 'deliver' or 'destroy' molds and designs, the obligation for proper disposal is removed but there is no guidance provided on how the supplier is to 'manage' these materials which contradicts the implied protection of Playboy's intellectual property. Section 3 previously had clear instructions to either deliver or destroy the molds. Changing it to simply 'manage' creates uncertainty and leaves the supplier open to dispose or handle them in any way they want, which potentially breaches intellectual property protection. This introduces uncertainty in enforcement, as 'manage' is vague.

perturbation.original_text: This Contract, when attached to a purchase order, shall consist of the entire agreement between the parties and shall supersede any conflicting or contrary terms and conditions of any purchase order or other order form whether supplied by Purchaser or Supplier.
perturbation.changed_text: This Contract, when attached to a purchase order, shall be a significant part of the agreement between the parties.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'shall consist of the entire agreement' and 'shall supersede any conflicting or contrary terms,' the contract now implies that other agreements or terms might exist. This contradicts the original intent of having a single, definitive agreement, creating ambiguity and allowing for external terms to be introduced which may compromise the intellectual property protection offered to Playboy. The original text made the Supplier contract a complete agreement, but the changed text opens the door for external terms to have an effect on this agreement.

perturbation.original_text: This Contract may not be modified or terminated except in writing, and no claimed modification, termination or waiver shall be binding unless also signed by an authorized representative of Playboy.
perturbation.changed_text: This Contract may be modified or terminated. Any modifications, terminations or waivers should be communicated to Playboy.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the stipulation that all modifications, terminations, or waivers must be 'in writing' and 'signed by an authorized representative of Playboy', the modified clause opens the door to verbal agreements or informal communications that could potentially alter the terms of the contract. This directly contradicts the intention of the original clause which aimed to prevent disputes arising from unapproved alterations of the agreement, especially regarding Playboy's protected intellectual property. The vagueness of merely 'communicating' with Playboy without requiring written consent creates a pathway for unauthorized changes. If another section states that all modifications should be in writing, this change creates a contradiction.
